If you are a journalist, please contact the University’s Media and PR Team:+44 117 428 2489press-office@bristol.ac.ukEdit profileResearch interestsResearcher in cyber security and privacy.Leveraging on my technical and socio-technical research methods I aim to understand how users perceive and use technology with regards to security and privacy. I am particularly interested in three areas, (1) usability, (2) privacy, and (3) trust. My research on usability focuses on understanding the usability practices and the challenges faced by users and operators alike when enforcing security and privacy measures. I aim to understand the challenges and propose viable solutions. Regarding privacy, I am interested in understanding users’ perceptions and norms around the use of smartphones and smarthome devices. My research on trust focuses on understanding the factors that engender trust in various applications such as peer to peer electricity trading platforms.Projects and supervisionsResearch projectsEquitable PrivacyAwais Rashid, Genevieve Liveley, Marvin Ramokapane, Nirav Ajmeri, Rui Huan, Nikhil PatnaikPrincipal InvestigatorAwais RashidRoleCo-InvestigatorDescriptionDigital technologies are becoming pervasive in society, from online shopping and social interactions through to finance, banking, transportation.
